turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm starving! Can you help me order some food? I'm in the mood for something...spicy.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay! To clarify, what's your current location so I can find restaurants near you? Also, when you say spicy, what kind of cuisine are you thinking of - Indian, Thai, Mexican, or something else?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Right, sorry. I'm at 123 Main Street, Anytown, USA. And hmm, maybe Thai? I'm open to suggestions though. Something beyond Pad Thai, please!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I see three Thai restaurants near you: 'Thai Delight', 'Spicy Basil', and 'Bangkok Bites'. 'Thai Delight' has great reviews for their green curry. 'Spicy Basil' is known for their Drunken Noodles, and 'Bangkok Bites' offers a unique spicy basil fried rice. Would you like to see their menus?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, I hate looking at menus. It takes forever. Which one has the absolute spiciest dish? Like, burn-your-face-off spicy. But also, you know, actually tastes good?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Based on user reviews, it seems Spicy Basil's 'Volcano Chicken' is consistently rated as the spiciest. Many reviewers mention needing extra water! However, some find it too spicy to enjoy. Thai Delight's 'Jungle Curry' is also very spicy and generally considered to have better flavor. I would recommend Thai Delight's Jungle Curry.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, Jungle Curry it is! Order it for me, medium spice. And a side of spring rolls. Thanks!
